title: Block (CSS)
summary:
A block on a webpage is an HTML element that appears on a new line, i.e. underneath the preceding element in a horizontal writing mode, and above the following element (commonly known as a block-level element). For example,

is by default a block-level element, whereas is an inline element â€” you can put several links next to one another in your HTML source and they will sit on the same line as one another in the rendered output.
